intro: Crambe scaberrima, commonly known as the rough crambe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and pinnately lobed leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in racemes. Crambe scaberrima is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
